definitions: To make a regular, soft sound, like that of a clock or watch.
To mark something with a tick (✓) to indicate that it is correct, has been checked, or has been completed.
To operate or function, especially in a precise or regular way.
examples: The clock on the wall began to tick loudly.
Please tick the boxes next to the items you have completed.
Time seemed to tick by slowly during the lecture.
The old engine continued to tick over smoothly.
